211011. Internal reforms of Charles II

Lorraine — Not random

Will happen within 3000 days of January 2, 1419
Checked again every 3000 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1430)

Description

Duke Charles II, surnamed 'le Hardi', the Bold, granted a right to be represented in the general estates of the Duchy to the Third Estate, i.e. the commons, who thus gained a certain extent of political power and voice for the first time in the history of Lorraine. Charles' motive for doing this was to limit and reduce the influence of the nobility and thereby strengthen Ducal authority.

Actions

A. The commons shall have a say

  • Stability -2
  • Aristocracy -1
  • Centralization +1
  • Serfdom -1
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 24 months

B. What is the Third Estate?

  • Stability +1

Back to top

211000. The Duke is dead

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • Provence exists

Will happen on January 26, 1431

Description

Upon the death of Duke Charles in 1431, his Duchy became a target of struggle between the French King Charles VII and duke Philippe III of Burgundy. By the will of Duke Charles, Lorraine was to pass to his daughter Isabella, who married René d'Anjou, duke of Bar, in 1420. This was disputed, however, by the male line heir Antoine, count of Vaudémont and nephew of Duke Charles. King Charles supported René d'Anjou with an army, but on the 2. July 1431 René lost to Antoine in the battle of Bugnéville and was imprisoned. His wife Isabella finally managed to negotiate for his ransom, and René was finally released after five years of capture. In a treaty confirmed at Chalons in 1445, Yolande, René's eldest daughter, married Antoine's son, Ferry II of Vaudemont, and René's second daughter Marguerite became the wife of Henry VI. of England.

Actions

A. René is the new Duke!

  • +200 relations with Provence
  • +100 relations with France
  • -100 relations with Burgundy
  • The capital province revolts
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 60 months
  • Gain a royal marriage with Provence
  • Event 262000 - The succession in Lorraine for Provence is triggered immediately
  • Event 262035 - The succession in Lorraine for Provence is triggered immediately

B. No! Antoine is the rightful heir!

  • Monarch René Ier d'Anjou will never rule
  • Monarch Jean II will never rule
  • Monarch Nicolas will never rule
  • Monarch René II will never rule
  • Monarch Antoine Ier ° becomes active
  • Monarch Ferry V ° becomes active
  • Monarch René II becomes active
  • -200 relations with Provence
  • -100 relations with France
  • +100 relations with Burgundy
  • Event 137008 - The succession in Lorraine for Burgundy is triggered immediately
  • Event 262001 - The succession in Lorraine for Provence is triggered immediately

Back to top

211001. The accession of René II

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • Provence exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 262000 - The succession in Lorraine for Provence has already occurred
    • Event 262035 - The succession in Lorraine for Provence has already occurred
  • Lorraine is a vassal of Provence

Will happen on August 25, 1473

Description

After the death of Duke Nicholas the title fell to René, grandson of the two combatants René d'Anjou and Antoine de Vaudémont. René II thus united the two rival lines in Lorraine.

Actions

A. Long live Duke René!

  • Break vassalization with Provence
  • Stability +2
  • Event 262002 - The accession of René II in Lorraine for Provence is triggered immediately

211006. The Anjou heritage

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 211004 - The House of Anjou-Lorraine in Provence for Lorraine has already occurred
  • The following must not occur:
    • Own Modena

Will happen within 30 days of July 11, 1480
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1482)

Description

With the extinction of the senior branch of the Anjous that previously ruled in Anjou, Provence, Lorraine and Naples the cadet branch of Anjou-Lorraine has risen to power. It is now a question if we should take up the mantle.

Actions

A. Yes - we are the Anjou!

  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Provence
  • Provence will be considered a claim province
  • Maine will be considered a claim province
  • Anjou will be considered a claim province
  • Abruzzo will be considered a claim province
  • Napule will be considered a claim province
  • Puglia will be considered a claim province
  • Calavria will be considered a claim province
  • Stability -3
  • -200 relations with France
  • -200 relations with Aragon
  • -200 relations with Spain
  • -200 relations with Papal States
  • -200 relations with Burgundy

B. Let bygones be bygones

  • Stability +1
  • +200 relations with France
  • +200 relations with Aragon
  • +200 relations with Spain
  • +100 relations with Papal States
  • +100 relations with Burgundy

211003. The House of Anjou-Lorraine in Provence

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • Provence exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 211002 - The succession in Provence for Lorraine has already occurred
    • Event 211013 - The succession in Provence for Lorraine has already occurred
  • Country is controlled by human

Will happen within 30 days of July 11, 1480
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1482)

Description

Following the death of the late Count of Provence the closest heir to the title is our Duke René II, the grandson of the late René of Provence. Following the accession of René II there is now a question about uniting our realm under one administration or not.

Actions

A. Unite the holdings of our House!

  • +1 victory points

B. There is no need for that

  • Event 262016 - The House of Anjou-Lorraine in Provence for Provence will never fire
  • Event 262017 - The House of Anjou-Lorraine in Provence for Provence will never fire

211009. The Guise Catholic League

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 170109 - The Catholic League for France has already occurred
    • FUC exists

Will happen within 30 days of June 11, 1584
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 24, 1588)

Description

In June 1584 the King's younger brother and heir appararent the duke of Anjou died, and with him died the hope many Frenchman had placed on his succession to the throne. Henry III had no son and was unlikely ever to have one. This left Henry of Navarre as heir, thereby raising the spectre that the next King of France might be a heretic. In September 1584 Henry duke of Guise and his brothers the duke of Mayenne and the Cardinal of Guise met at Nancy and founded league to keep Navarre off the throne. Philip II signed a treaty with the new League, and military operations began at once. By the end of the year, much of north and central France was under Guise control, and France was once again at war. Dynastically tied to the house of Lorraine, the Guise family held considerably sway with the Duke.

Actions

A. Support the Catholic League

  • -100 relations with FPR
  • Change religion to counterreform
  • +100 relations with FUC
  • Gain a royal marriage with FUC
  • -25
  • Event 172006 - Support from Lorraine for FUC is triggered immediately

B. Too risky!

  • -100 relations with FUC
  • +50 relations with FPR

Back to top

211010. The fate of Lorraine

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • Austria exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Austria is a vassal of Lorraine
  • Event 3632 - Habsburg Inheritance of Lothringen for Lorraine has already occurred
  • Monarch Joseph Ier ° is active

Will happen within 30 days of August 19, 1765
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after February 23, 1790)

Description

Following the death of Duke François III Stephan, his son Joseph Ier, also co-regent with his mother Maria Theresa of Austria, had the opportunity to incorporate the Duchy of Lorraine into the Habsburgs' hereditary dominions as the imperial fief of Lothringen. There is now a question about absorbing our ducal title into the imperial administration or not.

Actions

A. Unite the holdings of our House! (End Game)

  • Event 179126 - The reversion of Lothringen for Austria is triggered immediately

B. Keep the ducal title separate

  • -25 relations with Austria
  • +5 victory points

Back to top

3735. French Inheritance of Lothringen

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 3632 - Habsburg Inheritance of Lothringen for Lorraine has already occurred

Will happen within 1 days of February 23, 1766
Checked again every 1 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after February 24, 1766)

Description

On the death (1733) of Augustus II, Stanislaw returned to Poland from France and was again elected King. Under Russian pressure, a minority of the Polish diet chose instead Augustus III, precipitating the War of the Polish Succession. Stanislaw, besieged at Danzig, received only moral support from France, while his rival was backed by Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI and had full military aid from Russia. Stanislaw was obliged to flee from Danzig in 1734, and in 1735 he accepted the terms of the preliminary Treaty of Vienna. He kept the royal title but renounced his actual rights in favor of Augustus III. In exchange, he received Lorraine and Bar, with the provision that they were to pass directly to the French crown upon his death. The former duke of Lorraine (later Holy Roman Emperor Francis I) was compensated with the promise of Tuscany. Stanislaw' daughter, Maria Leszczynska, was married to Louis XV of France, but because of his many amorous escapades she appeals to the Pope to annul her marriage and he does. She immediately leaves France for Poland. When Stanislaw dies a couple of months later the petty noble of Lorraine declare the agreement of 1733 dissolved and they split the territory between them. But of course France will not look the other way...

Actions

A. France will inherit (End Game)

  • Event 3736 - French Inheritance of Lothringen for France is triggered immediately

B. Lothringen is divided among its noblemen

  • -200 relations with France
  • Stability -6

Back to top

20322. Burgundian Claims on Lorraine

Lorraine — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 137111 - King Charles for Burgundy
Action A of 28006 - King Charles for Burgundy

Description

The Emperor has made Philip the Good of Burgundy King of Lotharingia, reviving the ninth century Kingdom of Lothar. The emperor has granted some of our lands to Burgundy!

Actions

A. Damn!

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Burgundy for 2500 months
  • +6000 cavalry in the capital province
  • -50 relations with Austria
  • Gain an alliance with Provence
  • Gain an alliance with Switzerland

3632. Habsburg Inheritance of Lothringen

Lorraine — Not random

Triggered by

Action B of 3495 - The Polish Succession of 1733 for Poland
Action A of 3487 - Friedrich Augustus Wettin backs down for Poland

Description

In 1733 there had been great conflict in Europe centered on the election of King Stanislaw Leszczynski. Russia and Austria had supported Friedrich Augustus II's son, but he lost the election. War had been close and several plans had been discussed to secure peace for all. One was that Friedrich Augustus II's son got the throne and Stanislaw would have been compensated with Lorraine. However that situation never materialized and when François III Stephan of Lorraine married Maria-Theresia of Austria the lands of Lorraine would be inherited by their eldest son, Josef.

Actions

A. François III Stephan married Maria-Theresia

  • Monarch François III Stephan ° becomes active
  • Monarch Joseph Ier ° becomes active
  • Monarch Léopold II * becomes active
  • Monarch François IV * becomes active
  • Monarch Stanislas Ier will never rule
  • Monarch Noble Council * will never rule
  • +150 relations with Austria
  • Gain a royal marriage with Austria
  • Stability +5
  • +500
  • Event 17370 - The rule of the House of Lorraine for Tuscany will never fire
  • Event 193039 - The rule of the House of Lorraine for Italy will never fire
  • Event 3100 - Habsburg Inheritance of Lothringen for Austria is triggered immediately

211008. The revolt of the 'Rustauds'

Lorraine — Not random

Triggered by

Action B of 288001 - The peasants war for Strassburg

Description

In parallel to the movement of the Reform the revolt extended from the peasants. In 1525, they were 50.000 to devastate Low-Alsace, exceeded by the abuses of the nobility and the clergy. They spread the countryside setting fire castles, villages, small cities and abbeys which were on their way.
Strassburg sided with them and supports them. The revolt thus extends from our side of the border...

Actions

A. They shall pay for that!

  • Lorraine revolts
  • Lorraine revolts
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Strassburg for 36 months

Back to top

211002. The succession in Provence

Lorraine — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Lorraine is a vassal of Provence

Triggered by

Action B of 262014 - The succession in Provence for Provence
Action B of 262012 - The succession in Provence for Provence

Description

According to the will of the late King René his possessions were to be divided between his two heirs - René II of Lorraine and Charles II of Maine. Charles was to have Provence, while René was to inherit the duchy of Bar on the border of Lorraine. Duke René II disputed Charles' right to Provence, and now our claims to Provence has finally been acknowledged!

Actions

A. Excellent!

  • Gain Provence as vassals
  • +400 relations with Provence
  • -100 relations with France

Back to top
